intro: Iris chinensis, commonly known as Chinese iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It features sword-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. The flowers are pollinated by insects and are valued for their ornamental beauty in gardens.
